questions.question: Explain two Christian beliefs about the nature of God.
answer: First belief: God is omnipotent/all-powerful (1) which means He can do anything, as shown in the creation story (1)
Second belief: God is omnibenevolent/all-loving (1) which means He loves and cares for all His creation equally (1)
questions.explanation: This question tests knowledge of Christian beliefs about God's nature. Each belief needs a description and development for full marks.

questions.question: Explain two ways in which Muslims carry out Salah.
answer: First way: Muslims perform ritual washing/wudu before prayer (1) to ensure they are physically and spiritually clean (1)
Second way: Muslims face the direction of the Kabah/qibla (1) to show unity with Muslims worldwide/following Prophet Muhammad's example (1)
questions.explanation: This question tests knowledge of Islamic prayer practices. Each way needs a description and explanation for full marks.

questions.question: 'Divorce is always wrong.' Evaluate this statement.
answer: • Some Christians believe marriage is a sacred bond that should not be broken
• Jesus taught that divorce was against God's original plan
• Breaking marriage vows can harm families and children
• Some religious believers accept divorce in cases of adultery
• Modern interpretations recognize that some marriages become harmful
• Both Christianity and Islam allow divorce in certain circumstances
While religious teachings generally discourage divorce, most religions accept it may be necessary in some situations to prevent greater harm.
questions.explanation: This evaluation question requires consideration of different religious and moral viewpoints, supported by religious teachings and reaching a justified conclusion.

questions.question: Explain two religious beliefs about environmental sustainability.
answer: First belief: Humans have a duty of stewardship/khilafah (1) which means they must protect and care for God's creation (2)
Second belief: The world is sacred as God created it (1) so humans should not exploit or damage it (1)
questions.explanation: This question tests understanding of religious attitudes to environmental issues. Each belief needs explanation and religious teaching for full marks.
